reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I bought this large pack of scissors because for some reason scissors seem to walk away and disappear in my house. I think these are ok for accomplishing basic paper cutting, slicing open chip bags and poly mail bags. They are extremely lightweight compared to my other scissors purchased from Walmart, dollar store, etc. I think the handle holes could be a little larger as my fingers felt slightly cramped while cutting items. Due to these two characteristics, they don’t feel sturdy in hand while cutting. A couple times during use, the top blade closed down too far, surpassing the bottom blade a little. I tightened the screw and it seems to have fixed the issue. The blades are sharp and slice, easily. These will not work on heavier items such as cardboard. I go to my KitchenAid scissors for that. Overall, these will do, but my true opinion is the ones from the dollar tree are more comfortable and sturdy. If I wasn’t feeling so lazy, I would’ve made the trip to buy those instead. They’re cheaper and better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: these aren't the highest quality scissors but they are LOW cost and they do the job.i have somewhat larger hands and i'd say they are a bit tight but other than that, these scissors are great.
